## Invalid headers in upload
Setup: Use the publisher_csv_upload testdrive to setup for this test at /testdrive/publisher_csv_upload
Setup: At the end of the test please use the 'teardown' link provided by the testdrive to remove test assets from the system
Log in as the publisher account specified by the testdrive result

Go to the 'Validate your Journal CSV' tab in the publisher dashboard

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com/publisher/journal-csv

Expected Test Results: There is a page that offers you documentation and an upload box for your Journal CSV

Action:
Click 'Choose File' and select a CSV file with invalid headers

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/4008_premium/doajtest/doajtest/example_files/publisher_csv_invalid_headers.csv
Click 'Validate'

Expected Test Results: You are briefly shown a message to say that your file is being validated (this may appear only briefly, if you blink you may miss it)
Shortly after, you are shown a set of validation errors.  The following are the expected errors
A general error saying that "Journal ISSN (print version)" is a required header and is missing
An issue with the header row in Column A, warning that the header case is different from the expected header
An issue with the header row in Column K, saying "Extra unexpected header" is not a valid header

Action: If you are finished testing, you can teardown the testdrive using the link provided.  If you are going to continue with the other tests in this suite you can leave the testdrive in place until the very end

Setup: If you have not done so already, use the publisher_csv_upload testdrive to setup for this test at /testdrive/publisher_csv_upload
Log in as the publisher account specified by the testdrive result

Go to the 'Validate your Journal CSV' tab in the publisher dashboard

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/4008_premium/doajtest/doajtest/example_files/publisher_csv_invalid_data.csv
Click 'Validate'

Expected Test Results: You are shown a set of validation errors.  The following are the expected errors
Row 2 and Row 6 were not found in DOAJ
Row 3 is owned by another user
Row 4 did not provide any updates to the journal
Row 5 changed the journal title, which is not permitted
Row 7 had a selection of validation errors.  The errors are identified, and the original and newly supplied values are shown

## Valid uploads
Setup: If you have not done so already, use the publisher_csv_upload testdrive to setup for this test at /testdrive/publisher_csv_upload
Log in as the publisher account specified by the testdrive result

Go to the 'Validate your Journal CSV' tab in the publisher dashboard

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com/publisher/journal-csv
Click 'Validate' without selecting a file

Expected Test Results: You are shown a message saying that you must select a file to upload

Action:
Click 'Choose File' and select a CSV file with valid data that will generate warnings

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/4008_premium/doajtest/doajtest/example_files/publisher_csv_upload_warnings.csv
Click 'Validate'

Expected Test Results: You are shown a validation message that says validation is successful with warnings
You are shown a list of warnings.  The following are the expected warnings
One of the headers is in the wrong case
One of the rows does not provide an update to the data

Action:
Click 'Choose File' and select a CSV file with valid data that will not generate any warnings

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/4008_premium/doajtest/doajtest/example_files/publisher_csv_upload_success.csv
Click 'Validate'

Expected Test Results: You are shown a validation message that says validation is successful
